intro: Diphyes microblepharos, commonly known as the small-eyed diphyes, is a unique flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, small, rounded leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, pale yellow flowers that bloom during the late spring and early summer. Its botanical features include a fibrous root system and a preference for moist, well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
